newsitem.title: ITALY: Protesters removed from summit news conference.
newsitem.headline: Protesters removed from summit news conference.

text.p: Protesters disrupted Sunday's final news conference at the U.N.-sponsored World Food Summit and scuffled with security officials who moved in to eject them.

Several leaders, including Cuban President Fidel Castro, watched from the podium as the demonstrators, numbering about half a dozen, were removed from the room. One protester shouted "This is a farce," as she was dragged from the conference hall.
The woman screamed out: "You are participating in a criminal process." She appeared to be trying to stuff a copy of the main summit declaration into her mouth.

The five-day summit at the U.N. Food and Agriculture Organisation, which ended on Sunday, committed leaders to working to halve the number of hungry people in the world from 840 million now by the year 2015.
"This is a press conference, not a show," the summit's chief spokeswoman, Karen-Lis Svarre, said from the podium.

It was the second breach of security at the summit. Three women stripped naked in front of U.S. Agriculture Secretary Dan Glickman on Wednesday to protest against genetically manipulated soybeans at a news conference he held.
